column5: The link should have the images.  In Joy Charbonneauâ€™s artwork Hydrological Map of Canada, first created after three months in development as a limited-edition print in 2011, we see a vast land stripped of imposed borders, latitudinal hierarchies and self-important markings of human settlement, where the interconnected tracery of creeks, brooks, streams, rivers, basins and lakes is allowed to reclaim its quiet, rippling dominance.  http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/a-view-of-canadas-waterways/article27565222/?click=sf_globe
That is pretty cool!  Thanks for posting that!
